question: At schools, students should only be taught academic knowledge to pass the exams, and skills such as cookery, dressmaking and woodwork should be learned from family and friends. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
text: Academic subjects ought to teach by schools, so learners can achieve decent grades in the exams. Whereas, another domestic science subject can be inculcated by families and peers. The current essay disagrees with the phenomenon that fundamental life skills should learn at academic institutions. It explores, firstly, why skills related to art should cultivate in educates, and secondly, how to domestic skills education can be worthwhile among scholars.

To commence with, undeniably, skills-building classes must be mandatory in educational institutions because it accelerates the cognitive skills among the pupils. Alternatively,  when students engage in craft activities such as; designing, stitching, and weaving, and then they have to take each and every measurement for accomplishing tasks. Ultimately, mathematical skills proliferate and motor nerves become active. The survey conducted at the prestigious University of California revealed that the majority proportions of scholars acquire satisfactory grade owing to reason is they are proficient in measuring dimensions that would prove valuable in the future. Consequently, domestic skills are required for the holistic development of young people.

Another compelling cause, considering the current scenario, domestic science assists youth to put away gender stereotypes since both genders take part in every activity, which is related to the craft traits. This is to say,  both genders take part equally in all activities and get to know about the proficiency of the opposite gender. To exemplify,  ample of male the youngsters of India are proficient in cookery and run their own restaurant due to having knowledge of the craft skills . If the youth did not participate in domestic science skills, they would lose the chance to attain prosperity in life. Hence, physical skills would prove beneficial to remove discrimination among communities and render pavements to adult careers.
To conclude, undoubtedly, art education does not only beneficial for eradicating gender bias among societies, but also for learners to gain skills and continue in the future as a career.
